title.narrative: 03-01 COMMUNITY WATER SUPPLY

description.narrative: 3.1. By 2021, Government and partners have strengthened national capacity to legislate, coordinate, plan, deliver and monitor equity based water supply interventions in peri-urban and rural areas, which contributes to Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies, Water, Water (Covid), Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 3. By 2021, children (including adolescents), and pregnant women, especially those from rural and peri-urban areas, benefit from improved and equitable access to and use of systems that deliver safe drinking water, improved sanitation and improved hygiene practices.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 3.1. By 2021, Government and partners have strengthened national capacity to legislate, coordinate, plan, deliver and monitor equity based water supply interventions in peri-urban and rural areas

description.narrative: With UNICEF support during the first half of 2020, implementation of Statutory Instruments (SIs) for ground water and borehole regulation continued resulting in the registration of an additional 3,205 boreholes, 62 drilling firms and issuance of 1,387 drilling permits. An estimated 62,000 people gained access to basic water supply while over 54,000 drought affected people and 14,000 refugees benefitted from safe water supply | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2020

title.narrative: Additional number of people who gained access to basic drinking water source

National regulatory framework for drilling sector is in place
